curated_text: Symbol: ABBV. Year: 2024. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the California Business and Professions Code, AndroGel, King Drug Co., Florence, Inc., Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Abbott, sham litigation, the State of, Oregon Circuit Court, Forest Laboratories, LLC, Bystolic Antitrust Litigation, MDL, National Prescription Opiate Litigation, the United States Tax Court, AbbVie Inc., Subsidiaries, the Internal Revenue Service, Shareholder and Securities Litigation, Holwill, Humira, Allergan plc Securities Litigation, the United States Court of Appeals, the Second Circuit, Treppel Family Trust, the Food and Drug Administration’s, Camargo, Allergan Inc., the U.S. Patent Office, Intellectual Property Litigation AbbVie Inc., Reddy’s Laboratories, Ltd., Reddy’s Laboratories, Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd., Alembic Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Alembic Global Holdings SA, Genentech, Inc., Venclexta, Rinvoq, Hetero USA, Inc., Hetero Labs Limited Unit-V, Aurobindo Pharma Ltd., Sandoz, Sandoz Private Limited, Intas Pharmaceuticals Ltd., Accord Healthcare, Inc., Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Ltd., Aurobindo Pharma U.S.A., Aurobindo Pharma Limited, Zydus Pharmaceuticals, Zydus Lifesciences Limited, MSN Pharmaceuticals Inc., MSN Laboratories Private Limited, MSN Life Sciences Private Limited, Hetero USA Inc., Hetero Labs Limited Unit-III, Merck Sharp & Dohme, CODM, International 13 4 Total, Eye Care Ozurdex, Linzess/Constella United, ImmunoGen, ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION, the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, Supplementary Data, ImmunoGen, Inc., Consolidated Financial Statements, Research and Development Research, Phase 3b/4 Level-Up, HS, HS Clinical Response, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, FDA, Biologics License Application, FRα)-positive, Navitoclax •, Navitoclax, the European Union, RESULTS OF OPERATIONS Net Revenues, Percent, United States, Vraylar United States, Lumigan/Ganfort United States, Imbruvica, Botox Cosmetic, Juvederm Collection, Botox Therapeutic, Vraylar, Ubrelvy, SG&A, Upfront, Non-Operating Expenses (Income, Cerevel Therapeutics, LIQUIDITY, Credit Risk AbbVie. Context excerpt: competition provision of the California Business and Professions Code seeking injunctive relief, restitution, civil penalties and attorneys’ fees. In August 2019, direct purchasers of AndroGel filed a lawsuit, King Drug Co. of Florence, Inc., et al. v. AbbVie Inc., et al., against AbbVie and others in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania, alleging that 2006 patent litigation settlements and related agreements by Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (a company Abbott acquired in February 2010 and now known as AbbVie Products LLC) with three generic companies violated federal antitrust law, and also alleging that 2011 patent litigation by Abbott with two generic companies regarding AndroGel was sham litigation and the settlements of those litigations violated federal antitrust law. Plaintiffs generally seek monetary damages and/or injunctive relief and attorneys’ fees. In November 2022, the State of Oregon filed a lawsuit in the Multnomah County, Oregon Circu
